sen.j: 源 義国（みなもと の よしくに）は、平安時代後期の河内源氏の武将。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yoshikuni was a busho of Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan) in the late Heian period.
MINAMOTO no Yoshikuni was a busho of Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan) in the late Heian period.
MINAMOTO no Yoshikuni was a busho of Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan) in the late Heian period.

sen.j: 源義家の四男。
sen.e: He was the fourth son of MINAMOTO no Yoshiie.
He was the fourth son of MINAMOTO no Yoshiie.
He was the fourth son of MINAMOTO no Yoshiie.

sen.j: 新田氏・足利氏両氏の祖。
sen.e: He also was the ancestor of both Nitta clan and Ashikaga clan.
He also was the ancestor of both Nitta clan and Ashikaga clan.
He also was the ancestor of both Nitta clan and Ashikaga clan.

sen.j: 源義家の四男である。
sen.e: He was the fourth son of MINAMOTO no Yoshiie.
He was the fourth son of MINAMOTO no Yoshiie.
He was the fourth son of MINAMOTO no Yoshiie.

sen.j: 長男源義宗が早世し、次男源義親が西国で反乱を起こすと、兄の三男源義忠とともに次期「源氏の棟梁」としての期待を受けた。
sen.e: As Yoshiie's first son MINAMOTO no Yoshimune died prematurely and the second son MINAMOTO no Yoshichika raised a rebellion in Saigoku (western part of Japan), he was expected as the next 'toryo (leader) of Minamoto clan' as well as his elder brother and the third son, MINAMOTO no Yoshitada.

As Yoshiie's first son MINAMOTO no Yoshimune died prematurely and the second son MINAMOTO no Yoshichika raised a rebellion in Saigoku (western part of Japan), he was expected as the next 'toryo (leader) of Minamoto clan' as well as his elder brother and the third son, MINAMOTO no Yoshitada.

As Yoshiie's first son MINAMOTO no Yoshimune died prematurely and the second son MINAMOTO no Yoshichika raised a rebellion in Saigoku (western part of Japan), he was expected as the next 'toryo (leader) of Minamoto clan' as well as his elder brother and the third son, MINAMOTO no Yoshitada.

sen.j: しかし、乱暴狼藉を行ったことや、時代の趨勢にあわないと義家に判断されて後継者からはずされていった。
sen.e: However, Yoshikuni was excluded from candidate successors due to his rampageous behavior and Yoshiie's consideration that Yoshiie didn't match the trend of the era.
However, Yoshikuni was excluded from candidate successors due to his rampageous behavior and Yoshiie's consideration that Yoshiie didn't match the trend of the era.
However, Yoshikuni was excluded from candidate successors due to his rampageous behavior and Yoshiie's consideration that Yoshiie didn't match the trend of the era.

sen.j: 叔父義光との対立（常陸合戦）には敗れ、常陸国は義光流の佐竹氏に譲ることになったが、足利庄を成立させるなど、下野国に着実に勢力を築いていった。
sen.e: Though he was defeated in the confrontation with his uncle Yoshimitsu (Hitachi kassen) and ceded Hitachi Province to Satake clan who was the lineage of Yoshimitsu, he had steadily extended power over Shimotsuke Province through the establishment of Ashikagasho district and the like.

Though he was defeated in the confrontation with his uncle Yoshimitsu (Hitachi kassen) and ceded Hitachi Province to Satake clan who was the lineage of Yoshimitsu, he had steadily extended power over Shimotsuke Province through the establishment of Ashikagasho district and the like.

Though he was defeated in the confrontation with his uncle Yoshimitsu (Hitachi kassen) and ceded Hitachi Province to Satake clan who was the lineage of Yoshimitsu, he had steadily extended power over Shimotsuke Province through the establishment of Ashikagasho district and the like.

sen.j: 晩年にも勅勘を被るなど、気性の荒さは改まらず、荒加賀入道と言われた。
sen.e: His fierce character had not changed in his last years during which he tore up chokkan (the emperor's censure); he was called Arakaga nyudo (fierce lay monk of Kaga).
His fierce character had not changed in his last years during which he tore up chokkan (the emperor's censure); he was called Arakaga nyudo (fierce lay monk of Kaga).
His fierce character had not changed in his last years during which he tore up chokkan (the emperor's censure); he was called Arakaga nyudo (fierce lay monk of Kaga).

sen.j: 嘉承元年（1106年）、叔父源義光・従兄弟源義業と常陸国において合戦する。
sen.e: In 1106, he fought against his uncle MINAMOTO no Yoshimitsu and his cousin MINAMOTO no Yoshinari in Hitachi Province.
In 1106, he fought against his uncle MINAMOTO no Yoshimitsu and his cousin MINAMOTO no Yoshinari in Hitachi Province.
In 1106, he fought against his uncle MINAMOTO no Yoshimitsu and his cousin MINAMOTO no Yoshinari in Hitachi Province.

sen.j: いわゆる「常陸合戦」。
sen.e: The battle is so called 'Hitachi Kassen'.
The battle is so called 'Hitachi Kassen'.
The battle is so called 'Hitachi Kassen'.

sen.j: その結果、義国は勅勘を蒙り、父義家に捕縛命令が下りる。
sen.e: As a result, Yoshikuni received chokkan, and the arrest order for his father Yoshiie was issued.
As a result, Yoshikuni received chokkan, and the arrest order for his father Yoshiie was issued.
As a result, Yoshikuni received chokkan, and the arrest order for his father Yoshiie was issued.

sen.j: また、義光及びその与党、平重幹にも捕縛命令が各地の国司に下る。
sen.e: In addition, the arrest order for Yoshimitsu and his company 平重幹 was also issued toward Kokushi (provincial governor) in each district.
In addition, the arrest order for Yoshimitsu and his company 平重幹 was also issued toward Kokushi (provincial governor) in each district.
In addition, the arrest order for Yoshimitsu and his company 平重幹 was also issued toward Kokushi (provincial governor) in each district.

sen.j: 大治 (日本)2年（1127年）、次男・源義康が誕生。
sen.e: In 1127, his second son MINAMOTO no Yoshiyasu was born.
In 1127, his second son MINAMOTO no Yoshiyasu was born.
In 1127, his second son MINAMOTO no Yoshiyasu was born.

sen.j: 康治元年（1142年）、足利にある伝領を鳥羽天皇御願寺の安楽寿院に寄進し足利庄として成立させる（八条院領から大覚寺統へ伝領）。
sen.e: In 1142, he donated his traditional domain in Ashikaga to Anrakuju-in Temple which was goganji of Emperor Toba to turn it into Ashikagasho district (transferred from Hachijoin-ryo to Daikakuji-to).
In 1142, he donated his traditional domain in Ashikaga to Anrakuju-in Temple which was goganji of Emperor Toba to turn it into Ashikagasho district (transferred from Hachijoin-ryo to Daikakuji-to).
In 1142, he donated his traditional domain in Ashikaga to Anrakuju-in Temple which was goganji of Emperor Toba to turn it into Ashikagasho district (transferred from Hachijoin-ryo to Daikakuji-to).

sen.j: 康治2年（1143年）、梁田郡内の開発私領を伊勢神宮に寄進し梁田御厨を立券。
sen.e: In 1143, Yoshikuni donated his shiryo (private land) developed in Yanada County to Ise Jingu Shrine so that it was certified as Yanada mikuriya (manors of Imperial family and powerful shrines).
In 1143, Yoshikuni donated his shiryo (private land) developed in Yanada County to Ise Jingu Shrine so that it was certified as Yanada mikuriya (manors of Imperial family and powerful shrines).
In 1143, Yoshikuni donated his shiryo (private land) developed in Yanada County to Ise Jingu Shrine so that it was certified as Yanada mikuriya (manors of Imperial family and powerful shrines).

sen.j: 久安5年（1149年）、義国の郎党、京洛において乱闘し、義国が責任を問われる。
sen.e: In 1149, as Yoshikuni's roto (retainer) scuffled in Kyoto, Yoshikuni was accused of that.
In 1149, as Yoshikuni's roto (retainer) scuffled in Kyoto, Yoshikuni was accused of that.
In 1149, as Yoshikuni's roto (retainer) scuffled in Kyoto, Yoshikuni was accused of that.

sen.j: 久安6年（1150年）、右近衛大将大炊御門藤原実能と争い、実能の屋敷を焼き払い勅勘を蒙る。
sen.e: In 1150, Yoshikuni conflicted with Ukone no daisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) Oii Mikado FUJIWARA no Saneyoshi to burn down Saneyoshi's residence; Yoshikuni received chokkan.

In 1150, Yoshikuni conflicted with Ukone no daisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) Oii Mikado FUJIWARA no Saneyoshi to burn down Saneyoshi's residence; Yoshikuni received chokkan.

In 1150, Yoshikuni conflicted with Ukone no daisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) Oii Mikado FUJIWARA no Saneyoshi to burn down Saneyoshi's residence; Yoshikuni received chokkan.

sen.j: 久寿2年（1155年）、長男新田義重の新田荘の館で死去。
sen.e: In 1155, he died at the residence in Nitta no sho manor owned by his first son Yoshishige NITTA.
In 1155, he died at the residence in Nitta no sho manor owned by his first son Yoshishige NITTA.
In 1155, he died at the residence in Nitta no sho manor owned by his first son Yoshishige NITTA.

sen.j: 墓所は鑁阿寺（栃木県）にある。
sen.e: His graveyard is in Banna-ji Temple in Tochigi Prefecture.
His graveyard is in Banna-ji Temple in Tochigi Prefecture.
His graveyard is in Banna-ji Temple in Tochigi Prefecture.

sen.j: 義国の生年、没年は諸説があって定かではない。
sen.e: Yoshikuni's birth year and death year are uncertain with various theories.
Yoshikuni's birth year and death year are uncertain with various theories.
Yoshikuni's birth year and death year are uncertain with various theories.

sen.j: 通説では、寛治5年（1091年）生まれ、仁平4年（1154年）出家、久寿2年（1155年）6月26日 (旧暦)に死去となっている（尊卑分脈）。
sen.e: According to the popular theory, he was born in 1091, entered into priesthood in 1154 and died in 1155 (Sonpi Bunmyaku (Bloodlines of Noble and Base)).
According to the popular theory, he was born in 1091, entered into priesthood in 1154 and died in 1155 (Sonpi Bunmyaku (Bloodlines of Noble and Base)).
According to the popular theory, he was born in 1091, entered into priesthood in 1154 and died on August 3, 1155 (Sonpi Bunmyaku [Bloodlines of Noble and Base]).
sen.cmt: 死去の日付をグレゴリオ歴で補足しました。（）内の括弧を[]に変更しました。

sen.j: 参考に他の生年説を紹介
sen.e: Other theories about his birth and death years are introduced as a reference.
Other theories about his birth and death years are introduced as a reference.
Other theories about his birth and death years are introduced as a reference.

sen.j: 応徳元年（1084年）説 『系図纂要』記載。
sen.e: Birth year of 1084: described in "Keizu sanyo" (pedigree charts of Edo period).
Birth year of 1084: described in "Keizu sanyo" (pedigree charts of Edo period).
Birth year of 1084: described in "Keizu sanyo" (pedigree charts of Edo period).

sen.j: 寛治3年（1089年）説 上記の説の異説。
sen.e: Birth year of 1089: different theory of the above.
Birth year of 1089: different theory of the above.
Birth year of 1089: different theory of the above.

sen.j: 小説などでは採用が多いが詳細は不明。
sen.e: Though this theory is frequently adopted to novels and the like, details are not known.
Though this theory is frequently adopted to novels and the like, details are not known.
Though this theory is frequently adopted to novels and the like, details are not known.

sen.j: 採用している史書は特にない。
sen.e: This theory is not adopted by any history book.
This theory is not adopted by any history book.
This theory is not adopted by any history book.

sen.j: 永保2（1082年）説 足利鑁阿寺所蔵の「新田足利両家系図」に、義忠没時の義国の年齢を18歳と記している。
sen.e: Birth year of 1082: it is described that Yoshikuni was 18 when Yoshitada died, according to 'Nitta Ashikaga Ryo-kakeizu' (genealogies of both Nitta and Ashikaga families) owned by Ashikaga Banna-ji Temple.

Birth year of 1082: it is described that Yoshikuni was 18 when Yoshitada died, according to 'Nitta Ashikaga Ryo-kakeizu' (genealogies of both Nitta and Ashikaga families) owned by Ashikaga Banna-ji Temple.

Birth year of 1082: it is described that Yoshikuni was 18 when Yoshitada died, according to 'Nitta Ashikaga Ryo-kakeizu' (genealogies of both Nitta and Ashikaga families) owned by Ashikaga Banna-ji Temple.

sen.j: 昭和3年（1928年）発行の『足利市史』では、これを28歳の誤りであるとし、逆算して永保2年（1082年）誕生としている。
sen.e: According to the "History of Ashikaga City" issued in 1928, this is the mistake of 28; it estimates the birth year as 1082 by reverse calculation.
According to the "History of Ashikaga City" issued in 1928, the age was mistaken for 28; it estimates the birth year as 1082 by reverse calculation.
sen.cmt: mistake、語法上の問題を訂正しました。
sen.e: According to the "History of Ashikaga City" issued in 1928, the age was mistaken for 28; it estimates the birth year as 1082 by reverse calculation.

sen.j: 採用している史書「足利市史」。
sen.e: This theory is adopted by the history book, "History of Ashikaga City"
This theory is adopted by the history book, "History of Ashikaga City."
This theory is adopted by the history book, "History of Ashikaga City."

sen.j: 長男は源義重（新田氏の祖）母は上野介藤原敦基女、あるいは足利成綱女
sen.e: Yoshikuni's first son was MINAMOTO no Yoshishige (ancestor of Nitta clan); Yoshishige's mother was Kozuke no suke FUJIWARA no Atsumoto no musume, or Naritsuna ASHIKAGA no musume.
Yoshikuni's first son was MINAMOTO no Yoshishige (ancestor of Nitta clan); Yoshishige's mother was Kozuke no suke FUJIWARA no Atsumoto no musume, or Naritsuna ASHIKAGA no musume.
Yoshikuni's first son was MINAMOTO no Yoshishige (ancestor of Nitta clan); Yoshishige's mother was Kozuke no suke FUJIWARA no Atsumoto no musume, or Naritsuna ASHIKAGA no musume.

sen.j: 次男は源義康（足利氏の祖）母は信濃守源有房女
sen.e: His second son was MINAMOTO no Yoshiyasu (ancestor of Ashikaga clan); Yoshiyasu's mother was Shinano no kami MINAMOTO no Arifusa no musume.
His second son was MINAMOTO no Yoshiyasu (ancestor of Ashikaga clan); Yoshiyasu's mother was Shinano no kami MINAMOTO no Arifusa no musume.
His second son was MINAMOTO no Yoshiyasu (ancestor of Ashikaga clan); Yoshiyasu's mother was Shinano no kami MINAMOTO no Arifusa no musume.

sen.j: 三男は源季邦
sen.e: His third son was MINAMOTO no Suekuni.
His third son was MINAMOTO no Suekuni.
His third son was MINAMOTO no Suekuni.

sen.j: 末裔には山名氏、里見氏、桃井氏、石塔氏、吉良氏、今川氏、細川氏、畠山氏、斯波氏、一色氏、世良田氏などがある。
sen.e: Yoshikuni's descendants are Yamana clan, Satomi clan, Momoi clan, Ishito clan, Kira clan, Imagawa clan, Hosokawa clan, Hatakeyama clan, Shiba clan, Isshiki clan, Serata clan and the like.
Yoshikuni's descendants are Yamana clan, Satomi clan, Momoi clan, Ishito clan, Kira clan, Imagawa clan, Hosokawa clan, Hatakeyama clan, Shiba clan, Isshiki clan, Serata clan and the like.
Yoshikuni's descendants are Yamana clan, Satomi clan, Momoi clan, Ishito clan, Kira clan, Imagawa clan, Hosokawa clan, Hatakeyama clan, Shiba clan, Isshiki clan, Serata clan and the like.

sen.j: 鎌倉幕府倒幕時の鎌倉攻めの総大将新田義貞、室町幕府を開いた足利尊氏や桶狭間の戦いで織田信長に討たれた今川義元、室町前期に室町幕府の基礎を固めた斯波義将、畠山満家、応仁の乱の西軍、東軍の大将であった細川勝元、山名宗全らも彼の末裔である。
sen.e: Yoshisada NITTA who was the supreme commander in the capture of Kamakura at the overthrowing of Kamakura bakufu, Takauji ASHIKAGA who started Muromachi bakufu, Yoshimoto IMAGAWA who were killed by Nobunaga ODA in the Battle of Okehazama, Yoshimasa SHIBA and Mitsuie HATAKEYAMA who formed the foundation of Muromachi bakufu in the early Muromachi period, Katsumoto HOSOKAWA and Sozen YAMANA who were the taishoes (general) of the West squad and the East squad in the Onin War, respectively, and the like were Yoshikuni's descendants.

Yoshisada NITTA who was the supreme commander in the capture of Kamakura at the overthrowing of Kamakura bakufu, Takauji ASHIKAGA who started Muromachi bakufu, Yoshimoto IMAGAWA who were killed by Nobunaga ODA in the Battle of Okehazama, Yoshimasa SHIBA and Mitsuie HATAKEYAMA who formed the foundation of Muromachi bakufu in the early Muromachi period, Katsumoto HOSOKAWA and Sozen YAMANA who were the taishoes (general) of the West squad and the East squad in the Onin War, respectively, and the like were Yoshikuni's descendants.

Yoshisada NITTA who was the supreme commander in the capture of Kamakura at the overthrowing of Kamakura bakufu, Takauji ASHIKAGA who started Muromachi bakufu, Yoshimoto IMAGAWA who were killed by Nobunaga ODA in the Battle of Okehazama, Yoshimasa SHIBA and Mitsuie HATAKEYAMA who formed the foundation of Muromachi bakufu in the early Muromachi period, Katsumoto HOSOKAWA and Sozen YAMANA who were the taishoes (general) of the West squad and the East squad in the Onin War, respectively, and the like were Yoshikuni's descendants.
